title.value: Seasonal population dynamics and zooplankton distribution in littoral and profundal small eutrophic lake complexes
Сезонная динамика численности и распределение зоопланктона литоральных и профундальных комплексов малого эвтрофного озера

journal.title: Belarus Fish Industry Problems : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Kostousov, V.G., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus). Institute for Fish Industry
Baran, T.L., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus). Institute for Fish Industry

abstract.value: Eutrophication of the lakes as the process of natural aging leads to increase of trophic status and is attended by reorganization of the structure of plankton communities and decline of their biological difference. Retardation of the eutrophication rate leads to restructuration of plankton communities. Some features of the biomass dynamics and zooplankton communities spatial structuring of two small eutrophic lakes are examined in the article. Composition of dominant complexes of both lakes is almost completely similar with scant differentiations. In both experimental lakes predominance of pelagian associations upon litoral and unbalanced distribution and concentration of zooplankton within horizons is substantiated.
